ui.description: Measure your confidence and self-worth with this quick psychological test
ui.security: üîí Privacy: Your data is not stored

viral.title: What's Your Self-Esteem Score?
viral.subtitle: Find out now and compare with your friends!

amazonKeywords.HIGH: self-esteem, confidence, psychology, personal development, how to build confidence
amazonKeywords.LOW: recovering self-esteem, healing trauma, therapy, overcoming self-hate

guide.purpose: This test measures how you evaluate and accept yourself. Self-esteem is a foundational psychological trait for success, happiness, and healthy relationships.
guide.instruction: Read each of the 20 statements below and indicate how much you agree or disagree on a 5-point scale. There are no right or wrong answers. Your honest responses will give the most accurate results.
guide.interpretation: High self-esteem: You view yourself positively and embrace challenges | Moderate self-esteem: Your confidence varies by situation, and you have a balanced self-awareness | Low self-esteem: You tend to view yourself negatively and may benefit from self-development work

SE.name: Overall Self-Esteem
SE.detail: The degree to which you evaluate yourself positively and believe in your abilities. Higher scores indicate greater resilience after failure and more active engagement with new challenges.
SE.tip: üí° Building a daily habit of acknowledging small achievements gradually increases your self-esteem.

CONF.name: Confidence
CONF.detail: Your belief in your capabilities and certainty in handling situations. This is a key factor in social success and professional achievement.
CONF.tip: üí° Repeated small victories naturally build lasting confidence.

WORTH.name: Self-Worth
WORTH.detail: The degree to which you recognize yourself as inherently valuable without conditions. This means feeling your worth independent of others' judgments.
WORTH.tip: üí° Accepting yourself as you are, rather than pursuing perfection, is essential for growth.

items.text: I have a positive view of myself.
When I fail at something, I lose confidence easily.
I am confident in my abilities.
I believe I am as capable as most other people.
I respect myself.
I think I am an inadequate person.
When facing new challenges, I believe I can succeed.
Others' opinions greatly influence how I behave.
I have a balanced understanding of my strengths and weaknesses.
When I fail, I learn from it and try again.
I usually regret my decisions.
I can express my opinions confidently.
I accept myself as I am.
I am easily hurt by criticism.
I feel inferior compared to other people.
I believe I can accomplish things I set out to do.
I fear failure.
I think my worth depends on others' evaluation of me.
I love myself.
I can remain composed even in difficult situations.

ranges.description: You are viewing yourself very negatively right now. You struggle to believe in your abilities and are easily hurt by criticism.
recommendation: Consider speaking with a mental health professional
Intentionally create small success experiences
Challenge negative self-talk with realistic positive thoughts
Identify and document your strengths

ranges.description: Your self-esteem is on the lower side. You tend to underestimate your abilities and hesitate before new challenges.
recommendation: Practice acknowledging your accomplishments
Step away from constant comparison and competition
Spend time with people who encourage and support you
Practice saying to yourself what you'd say to a good friend

ranges.description: Your self-esteem is well-balanced. You view yourself positively while still recognizing areas for growth. You maintain appropriate confidence in most situations.
recommendation: Keep up your positive mindset
Practice trusting yourself even when facing challenges
View setbacks as learning opportunities
Share your experiences with others

ranges.description: You have healthy self-esteem. You believe in your abilities and face challenges confidently. You bounce back well from failure.
recommendation: Leverage your strengths more in your daily life
Set ambitious goals and pursue them
Share your confidence and encouragement with others
Continue cultivating a growth mindset

ranges.description: You have very high self-esteem. You view yourself extremely positively and face any challenge with confidence.
recommendation: Be mindful that confidence doesn't tip into arrogance
Value and respect others' perspectives as well
Maintain balance between self-assurance and humility
Use your strengths to help and inspire those around you
